snippet: Charles Pierrepont Henry Gilbert’s town houses came to define the upper-class residence. But as a young man, he designed some flamboyant, urban dwellings in Brooklyn.
abstract: Christopher Gray Streetscapes column on the history of Brooklyn town houses designed by Charles Pierrepont Henry Gilbert in the 1880s, earning him a place in the New York architecture scene.
lead_paragraph: Charles Pierrepont Henry Gilbert’s town houses came to define the upper-class residence. But as a young man, he designed some flamboyant, urban dwellings in Brooklyn.

headline.seo: Brooklyn/Streetscapes - C. P. H. Gilbert: The Wild Years
headline.main: C. P. H. Gilbert: The Wild Years
